header_summary: Tom Briar is updating code and adding a new RPC endpoint to warn users about uncompressed TxIds. ZmnSCPxj expresses interest in Lightning as a scaling solution and suggests integrating useful features developed on sidechains into Bitcoin. Nick Farrow discusses a draft scheme involving blinding and FROST compatibility for Schnorr signatures. David Stainton proposes improving the performance of the Sphinx cryptographic packet format. Atomic Mr Nuclear clarifies the permissionless nature of Bitcoin and the permissioned nature of the Lightning channel. Antoine Riard suggests investigating anonymous credentials to defend against botnets and shares links to resources on reputation credentials and RSA blind signatures.

recent_posts.title: Compressed Bitcoin Transactions
recent_posts.summary:
- Tom informs Jonas that he is working on obtaining numbers based on historical data and fuzz tests.
- Tom mentions that he is updating the code to align with the documentation.
- Tom plans to add a compressrawtransaction RPC endpoint and include this information in the documentation.

recent_posts.title: Sentinel Chains: A Novel Two-Way Peg
recent_posts.summary:
- The sender initially shows interested in sidechains as a scaling solution for blockchains but later realizes their limitations.
- They suggest Lightning as a non-blockchain mechanism for scaling blockchains instead.
- For developing new features, the sender proposes a federated sidechain and mentions an alternative idea called "mainstake."

recent_posts.title: Private Collaborative Custody with FROST
recent_posts.summary:
- The email discusses a draft scheme that explains blinding and FROST compatibility.
- The scheme involves obtaining a public nonce, creating an aggregate nonce, and calculating a challenge.
- Collaborative signing sessions should be conducted sequentially to mitigate potential risks.

recent_posts.title: faster NIKE Sphinx or more secure KEM Sphinx
recent_posts.summary:
- David Stainton expresses concern about the performance of the Sphinx cryptographic packet format.
- He proposes improving performance by eliminating certain operations and combining different KEMs.
- David also addresses the bandwidth overhead and refers to a paper on security preserving KEM combiners.

recent_posts.title: Nucleus: Capital-efficient multipeer Lightning payment channels
recent_posts.summary:
- The Bitcoin blockchain operates on a permissionless peer-to-peer layer but Lightning channels are permissioned.
- Lightning channels require authorization from all participants, providing protection against Sybil attacks.
- The sender explains the distinction between Bitcoin's permissionless nature and Lightning's permissioned system.

recent_posts.title: TOR enabled dynamic Proof of Work defense for onion services
recent_posts.summary:
- Antoine discusses defending against a botnet and suggests investigating anonymous credentials.
- During the Zurich lightning event, bip154 was discarded due to its limitations.
- Antoine implemented Privacy Pass, replacing cryptosystems and working on a Rust implementation.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- Tom Trevethan is implementing a version of 2-of-2 Schnorr Musig2 for statechains.
- In the model of blinded statechains, the server will not have access to certain information.
- The 2-of-2 musig2 protocol involves key and nonce aggregation for generating signatures.

active_posts.title: Ark: An Alternative Privacy-preserving Second Layer Solution
active_posts.summary:
- A new second-layer protocol called Ark has been released as an alternative to Lightning.
- Ark allows users to send and receive funds without liquidity constraints, using virtual UTXOs.
- Ark's anonymous payments are facilitated by an untrusted intermediary called the Ark Service Provider.

active_posts.title: Concrete MATT opcodes
active_posts.summary:
- Salvatore Ingala has presented a complete proposal for MATT's core opcodes in bitcoin-inquisition repo.
- The proposal includes introducing OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY (CCV) and modifying parameter order for better script writing.
- With OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY and OP_CAT, the full generality of MATT can be achieved.

active_posts.title: Resumable channels using OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal suggests a new way to make lightning channels resumable from a wallet seed.
- It introduces a new type of channel funding transaction with additional spending path.
- The proposal includes fraud proofs to detect revoked states and discusses saving bandwidth.

active_posts.title: LN Summit 2024 Organization
active_posts.summary:
- Antoine Riard proposes organizing the LN Summit in Africa in June 2024.
- The summit aims to build local Lightning economies and promote fairness and transparency.
- Antoine invites objections and feedback, highlighting his commitment to transparency and accountability.

active_posts.title: Jamming Mitigation Dry Run
active_posts.summary:
- We will conduct a "dry run" of HTLC endorsement and local reputation tracking.
- The plan includes collecting anonymized forwarding data, propagating an experimental TLV, and implementing local reputation algorithms.
- Privacy and protection of sensitive information are prioritized throughout the process.
